meanings.definition: An estimate of income and expenditure for a set period of time.
meanings.sent1: My mom creates budgets to track how much money we have for the month.
meanings.sent2: The company's budgets help them plan their finances for the year ahead.
meanings.sent3: The budgets for our family vacation were so tight, we had to skip dessert at dinner.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, budgets are like roadmaps guiding spending decisions.
meanings.sent5: Learning to create budgets is an essential skill for managing your finances.

meanings.definition: Allocate funds for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The government budgets money for education to improve schools.
meanings.sent2: She budgets a portion of her salary each month for savings.
meanings.sent3: I budgeted time for studying before the big exam.
meanings.sent4: He budgets his energy throughout the day to avoid burnout.
meanings.sent5: Budgeting wisely ensures you have enough for all your needs.

meanings.definition: A plan for saving or spending money.
meanings.sent1: Creating a budget helped me save up for a new bike.
meanings.sent2: Their budget for home renovations allowed them to upgrade the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The budget for shopping was quickly blown when she saw the sale.
meanings.sent4: A budget is like a financial diet, controlling your spending habits.
meanings.sent5: Budgets can give you peace of mind knowing where your money is going.
